answers.answer: What you shoukd do when you get to your dr ask questions. Because you do have type 2 diabetes make sure you monitor your sugar intake because if its a bit high it can cause your baby to slow done in fetal movement. But otherwise thats what they do. One day there moving like they doing martial arts and then theres days when they are chilling but its always good to get a couple of  movements a day. You should be fine if your feeling fine and your sugar level is ok.  God bless!

Mine is active sometimes but quiet a lot unless you irritate her by pushing on my stomach.... Some pregnancies are like that (though I wish mine would get the memo 4 am is not kick the crap out of mom time lol) - but as suggested, bring it up to your doctor next visit- if anything you'll get answers and feel better.
Thank you! That makes me feel a lot better

question: Hi February mommies, I have a question for you. I am due February 3rd and I had a Dr's appt Thursday, November 6 th and my baby girl's heart rate was 158. But I am a little worried because she is not moving much. I am a type 2 diabetic and my sugar levels are not stable. Is anyone else's baby being more lazy than active? I go back to the Dr on Wednesday, November 12th for an ultrasound. My husband says she is fine and I am worried for nothing but what do you think?
title: Little worried
